channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: The big VAR debate: with, without or change its scope?
item.description: After a weekend of FA Cup action without VAR, BBC Sport ask managers, fans and pundits whether the game needs technology - and what needs to change.

item.title: 183 team changes in 14 ties - but does it really matter for the FA Cup?
item.description: Does 183 team changes in 14 ties devalue the FA Cup? Chief football writer Phil McNulty insists the cup retains its old magic.

item.title: 'A throwback' - Wolves beat Grimsby in FA Cup mudbath
item.description: Premier League Wolves edge League Two Grimsby in an "old school cup tie" which provided an FA Cup "throwback".

item.title: Celtic spirit reminds O'Neill of glory years
item.description: Interim manager Martin O'Neill says the current side's fighting spirit reminds him of his previous Celtic glory years after their comeback win in Kilmarnock.

item.title: Spurs unstoppable in 10-goal thriller against Aston Villa
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur put 7 goals past Aston Villa to keep themselves in the running for a Champions League place.

item.title: Leeds beat Birmingham on penalties in FA Cup
item.description: Watch highlights as Leeds United hold their nerve to beat Championship oppponents Birmingham City 4-2 on penalties and reach the FA Cup fifth round.

item.title: 'It was cruel' - slick Spurs hit seven but Ho still not satisfied
item.description: Aston Villa manager Natalia Arroyo was disappointed by side's 7-3 defeat by Tottenham while opposite number Martin Ho wanted more goals.

item.title: Bueno earns Wolves FA Cup win at muddy Grimsby
item.description: Watch Premier League strugglers Wolves overcome a muddy pitch to beat Grimsby Town at Blundell Park and reach the FA Cup fifth round.

item.title: James instrumental as Chelsea beat Liverpool
item.description: Lauren James is instrumental in Chelsea's 2-0 win over Liverpool as she assists Sjoeke Nusken before scoring her side's second.

item.title: Turner orchestrates Man Utd comeback against London City Lionesses
item.description: Millie Turner assists and then scores on her first start back from injury to help Manchester United come from behind and beat London City Lionesses 2-1.

item.title: Reed & Kevin earn Fulham comeback win at Stoke
item.description: Second half goals from Kevin and Harrison Reed helped Fulham beat Stoke City and earn a place in the FA Cup fifth round.

item.title: Sunderland beat spirited Oxford in FA Cup
item.description: Watch highlights as Sunderland edge past Championship strugglers Oxford United to move into the FA Cup fifth round.

item.title: Pereira announced as Forest boss on 18-month deal
item.description: Nottingham Forest appoint Vitor Pereira on an 18-month deal as the 57-year-old becomes the club's fourth manager of the campaign.

item.title: 'I'm buzzing' - Man Utd's Skinner toasts seventh-straight win
item.description: Manchester United are getting the job done when it matters most - and their seven-game winning streak has gone under the radar.

item.title: Captain Van Dijk wants 'so important' Salah to stay
item.description: Liverpool captain hails the importance of Mohamed Salah, why the Egyptian brings more than goals and his desire for Salah to stay beyond the summer

item.title: Three years on, Deulofeu is still fighting for 'miracle' return
item.description: Gerard Deulofeu has not played for more than three years but believes he can make "history" by fighting for a "miracle" comeback.

item.title: Kane reaches 500 goals - what other records could he break?
item.description: Bayern Munich striker Harry Kane became the first Englishman to reach 500 career goals on Saturday, but what other records could he break?

item.title: 'The officials looked petrified' - was Villa Park chaos advert for VAR?
item.description: Newcastle United beat Aston Villa in the FA Cup fourth round in a match dominated by a number of controversial decisions without VAR.

item.title: Brighton v Arsenal postponed because of waterlogged pitch
item.description: Brighton's game at home to Arsenal in the Women's Super League on Sunday is postponed because of a waterlogged pitch.

item.title: Benatia leaves Marseille amid 'growing dissatisfaction'
item.description: Marseille sporting director Medhi Benatia says he is leaving his role just days after the exit of Roberto de Zerbi as manager of the French club.

item.title: Brilliant Mansfield pile pressure on Parker - is his time up at Burnley?
item.description: Burnley manager Scott Parker is under increasing pressure as the Premier League side are dumped out of the FA Cup by League One Mansfield.

item.title: Early Everton goal enough to beat West Ham United
item.description: Everton hold out after taking an early lead to beat West Ham 1-0 and secure their third straight win in the WSL for the first time in three years.

item.title: Salah shines as Liverpool comfortably beat Brighton
item.description: Goals from Curtis Jones, Dominik Szoboszlai and Mohamed Salah give Liverpool a comfortable 3-0 win over Brighton in the fourth round of the FA Cup at Anfield.

item.title: 'One of worst decisions I've ever seen' - Rooney on Digne handball
item.description: Wayne Rooney and Alan Shearer believe referees are "petrified" of making decisions without the "safety net of VAR", after the officials award a free-kick instead of a penalty despite Aston Villa's Lucas Digne handling the ball in the box.

item.title: Alexander-Arnold assists opener as Real Madrid thrash Sociedad
item.description: Trent Alexander-Arnold claims an assist on his first start in more than two months as Real Madrid beat Real Sociedad to move top of La Liga.

item.title: Tonali inspires Newcastle to win over Villa in controversial tie
item.description: Sandro Tonali scores twice as Newcastle United overcome multiple controversial refereeing decisions to knock 10-man Aston Villa out of the FA Cup.

item.title: From 'demoralising' 8-0 defeat to pushing Man City all the way
item.description: Thirteen months after being embarrassed 8-0 by Manchester City, Salford City produce a performance to make their fans proud.

item.title: 'Not what I expected' - Trafford on Man City back-up role
item.description: James Trafford admits his role as second choice at Manchester City is not what he expected "coming into the season" after the win over Salford City in the FA Cup.

item.title: What's the state of play in top-six scramble?
item.description: A four-way battle is shaping up for two places in the top half of the Scottish Premiership.

item.title: Kane becomes first Englishman to 500 career goals
item.description: Bayern Munich striker Harry Kane strikes from distance against Werder Bremen to become the first Englishman in history to score 500 professional goals in official matches.

item.title: How is Zubimendi helping Arsenal's title push?
item.description: BBC football tactics correspondent Umir Irfan analyses how Martin Zubimendi is playing a key part in Arsenal's hunt for the Premier League title.

item.title: Mansfield's Reed scores fabulous free-kick to upset Burnley
item.description: Watch Mansfield Town's Louis Reed produce "set-piece sorcery," scoring a sensational free kick to stun Premier League side Burnley and reach the FA Cup fifth round.

item.title: 'What is he doing?' - Villa keeper Bizot shown red card
item.description: Aston Villa goalkeeper Marco Bizot is shown a straight red card for a "naughty challenge" on Newcastle United's Jacob Murphy in their FA Cup fourth round tie at Villa Park.

item.title: How 'world class' Szoboszlai shone against Brighton
item.description: BBC Sport pundit Shay Given believes Dominik Szoboszlai has "gone up a level" despite his team's dip in form this season, as the Hungarian midfielder was on the scoresheet once again for Liverpool in their 3-0 win over Brighton in the FA Cup.

item.title: FA Cup winners' medal, Odegaard's armband and Pictionary with Arteta
item.description: As his team prepare to face his old club Arsenal, Wigan midfielder Matt Smith tells BBC Sport about his FA Cup final winners' medal and the advice Mikel Arteta gave him before he left.

item.title: Saviour Summerville is West Ham's man of the moment
item.description: Crysencio Summerville is West Ham's saviour again as the Hammers beat Burton to move into the FA Cup fifth round.

item.title: A 'very special' FA Cup win and why managing Ronaldo is 'easy'
item.description: Portugal manager Roberto Martinez sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his life in football.

item.title: Howe was never under any pressure - Shearer
item.description: BBC Sport pundits Alan Shearer, Wayne Rooney and Dion Dublin believe Eddie Howe has the support of his players and that his future at the club shouldn't be called into question, regardless of any dips in form for Newcastle this season.

item.title: Offside? Abraham scores controversial opener for Villa
item.description: A well-worked free-kick routine is finished off by Tammy Abraham for his first goal since returning to Aston Villa, but the replays show the goal would have been ruled out for offside had VAR been in use.

item.title: Digne should have been sent off for 'dangerous tackle' - Shearer
item.description: Alan Shearer, Wayne Rooney and Dion Dublin discuss if Aston Villa's Lucas Digne should have Aston Villa for a high challenge on Jacob Murphy.

item.title: Guehi scores as Man City beat spirited Salford
item.description: Marc Guehi scores his first goal for Manchester City to seal a 2-0 win for the Premier League side over League Two Salford City in the fourth round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Skipp scores stunning bicycle kick against Southampton
item.description: Oliver Skipp scores a stunning overhead kick to bring Leicester City level against Southampton in the fourth round of the FA Cup.

item.title: 'Intense, aggressive, entertaining' - what will new boss Tudor bring to Spurs?
item.description: After Igor Tudor agrees to take charge of Tottenham for the remainder of the season, BBC Sport takes a look at what supporters can expect to see from his side.

item.title: Sutton's FA Cup fourth-round predictions v Daffy Duck & Porky Pig
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Daffy Duck and Porky Pig - and AI - with his predictions for all 16 FA Cup fourth-round ties.

item.title: 'I had to put everyone on edge' - how managers make an impact
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains the key things a manager can do before, during and after matches to get the results they want.

item.title: To boo, or not to boo? Do players notice and why do fans do it?
item.description: Booing at football is an accepted part of the game. It's been around since time began, but are fans increasingly booing their own team?

item.title: Did Dyche deserve the sack at Nottingham Forest?
item.description: After Sean Dyche's reign lasts just 114 days, Nottingham Forest are on the hunt for a fourth head coach of the season - but was he hard done by?

item.title: All February's done deals, including deadline day, in one place
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: How does the Nations League work and when is the draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains how the Uefa Nations League works ahead of the draw for the 2026-27 competition

item.title: What do you get for winning EFL Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the winner of the Carabao Cup gets.

item.title: When is transfer deadline day around the world?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when the transfer deadline is set around the world.

item.title: How many players are clubs allowed to loan out?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain the rules around how many players clubs are allowed to send out on loan

item.title: What happens during a football medical?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain what is involved in a medical exam when a football player joins a new club.

item.title: What is a transfer deal sheet?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at what a transfer deal sheet is and why it is needed for transfers on deadline day.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: 'Celtic and Rangers eye Dundee's Graham' - gossip
item.description: Both sides of the Old Firm are reportedly interested in Dundee's Luke Graham while Kilmarnock's David Watson is ignoring speculation about his future.

item.title: Barcelona withdraw from European Super League project
item.description: Barcelona withdraw from the European Super League project, leaving rivals Real Madrid as the only one of the original 12 clubs still signed up to the plans.

item.title: Cologne youth team break record with 50,000 crowd
item.description: Cologne's Under-19s break the attendance record for a Uefa Youth League match with 50,000 people watching the side take on Inter Milan.

item.title: Ex-Villa striker Duran signs for sixth club aged 22
item.description: Former Aston Villa striker Jhon Duran joins the sixth club of his career at the age of just 22 as he signs for Zenit St Petersburg on loan.

item.title: Booed by some, loved by others - why does Vinicius divide Real fans?
item.description: Despite scoring a vital goal against Rayo Vallecano, why does forward Vinicius Jr continue to split opinion at the Bernabeu?

item.title: Frank's downfall: Inside his struggle to get players and fans onboard
item.description: Thomas Frank has been sacked as Tottenham manager after just eight months in charge. BBC Sport's Sami Mokbel takes a closer look at his tenure.

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.
